Using CMake to build the ADTF StreamingLib Examples

ADTF StreamingLib ships CMake build files and configurations that require at least CMake Version 2.8.4.

Only the Debug and the RelWithDebInfo configurations are supported by ADTF StreamingLib.

Building the examples

Note that if you paste some paths from the clipboard into cmake gui, make sure that you replace all backslashes with forward slashes (paste it, then press "..." and ok)!

  1. Launch cmake-gui
  2. Set the source directory to the installation directory of ADTF StreamingLib (e.g C:/Tools/adtf-streaminglib).
  3. Set the build/binary directory to a NEW and different directory (e.g. C:/Work/streaminglib-build)
  4. Press configure.
  5. Click 'yes' when cmake asks to create the build directory.
  6. Select your compiler in the dialog that appears now and press 'Finish'.
  7. You will now get red values in the list, red does not mean wrong but new!
  8. Press Configure again.
  9. Set CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX to the installation directory of ADTF StreamingLib (e.g C:/Tools/adtf-streaminglib). You can choose any directory you like.
  10. Press Configure again.
  11. You should now have everything ready and no red values.
  12. On Linux make sure that you set CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE to either "Debug" or "RelWithDebInfo" and if you get an empty ADTF_FONTCONFIG_LIBRARY please install the fontconfig development package of your linux distribution.
  13. Press Generate.
  14. Now go to the build directory:
    • On Windows open the adtf_streaminglib_examples solution with Visual Studio and build it. Don't forget to build the INSTALL project after everything has been built.
    • On Linux type 'make install' in the build directory.
  15. done
